en.sc1: Consider a graph of cost over all inputs of a given size $n$ for some algorithm for a given problem.
en.sc2: The worst case for this algorithm is represented by this red point.
en.sc3: Define $A$ to be the collection of all algorithms that solve the problem. (Theoretically, there are an infinite number of such algorithms.)
en.sc4: The graphs of the cost over all inputs of a given size $n$ will look like the following. (We are only showing the graphs of 4 algorithms here.)
en.sc5: The worst case lower bound is the least of all the highest points on all the graphs. (The circled point)
